intro: Catopsis mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican catopsis, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family, which includes many epiphytic and terrestrial plants. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often on tree trunks or in rocky crevices. Its leaves are sword-shaped and can form a rosette, while its inflorescence consists of small, clustered flowers. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated as a houseplant.
